name: interpersonally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is connected with the relationships between people: In my late teens, I became more interpersonally confident and better able to manage my life. She is interpersonally insecure, which makes her prone to displays of anger.
More examplesFewer examplesProviding negative feedback to colleagues is one of the most interpersonally difficult tasks that a manager has to perform.She lacks the necessary skills for the job, both technically and interpersonally.He has a mental illness which lowers his ability to function interpersonally.
